intro: Solenanthus abayi, commonly known as the Borneo daisy, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branching. Solenanthus abayi plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity in its native habitat.
